ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Save a Sherpa data set to an ASCII file.

SYNTAX.LINE: save_data( [id,] filename [, fields=None, sep="", comment="#", clobber=False] )

DESC.PARA: The save_data command saves a dataset to a column-based ASCII file. Optional arguments allow the user to assign column names, a column separator, or a comment character. This command has no return value.

The save_table command can be used to create a FITS format output file
("ahelp save_table").

LIST.ITEM: id - the id of the dataset to use; if not given, uses the default dataset id (id=1 by default, see "ahelp get_default_id")
filename - the output filename, including path
fields - names for the output columns
sep - the column-separating character; default is a space (" ")
comment - character which indicates a comment line; default=#

DESC.PARA: Save dataset 1 as an ASCII file named "data.dat", using the default settings.
Dataset "src" is written to the file "source.ascii". The column names are "x" and "y", and the separator is set to "&". (This can be useful, for instance, to create a latex table from the output.)

BUGS.PARA: See the bugs pages on the Sherpa website for an up-to-date listing of known bugs.
